citeinfo.origin: Natural Resources Commission (creator); Bernardin-Lochmueller and Associates (compiler)
citeinfo.title: RIVERS_OUTSTANDING_NRC_IN: Outstanding Rivers in Indiana Listed by the Natural Resource Commission (Bernardin-Lochmueller and Associates, 1:100,000, Line Shapefile)
citeinfo.othercit:
RIVERS_OUTSTANDING_NRC_IN was created from data published by the Natural Resource Commission (NRC) listing the “Outstanding Rivers List for Indiana”. This list is available at the following URL:
http://www.in.gov/nrc/policy/outstand.html.

descript.abstract:
RIVERS_OUTSTANDING_NRC_IN represents river and stream segments on the NRC’s Outstanding Rivers list for Indiana. The source data was last updated in October 1997. Stream segments were obtained from 1:100K National Hydrography Dataset.
The following was excerpted from the website for the Natural Resources Commission:
"In 1993, the Natural Resources Commission adopted its "Outstanding Rivers List for Indiana." The listing was published in the Indiana Register on March 1 of that year as Information Bulletin #4 in Volume 16, Number 6, page 1677 through 1680 (sometimes cited as 16 IR 1677). The listing has also been specifically incorporated by reference into statutes and rules. Notably, the listing is referenced in the standards for utility line crossings within floodways, formerly governed by IC 14-28-2 and now controlled by 310 IAC 6-1-16 through 310 IAC 6-1-18. See, also, the general permit for logjam removals, implemented as an emergency rule and pending for adoption as a permanent rule at 310 IAC 6-1-20. Except where incorporated into a statute or rule, the listing is intended to provide guidance rather than to have regulatory application.
A special listing was prepared by the division of outdoor recreation of the department of natural resources. The listing is a corrected and condensed version of a listing complied by American Rivers and dated October 1990. There are about 2,000 river miles included on the listing, a figure which represents less than 9% of the estimated 24,000 total river miles in Indiana. The natural resources commission has adopted the listing as an official recognition of the resource values of these waters."
descript.purpose:
The following was excerpted from the website for the Natural Resources Commission:
To help identify the rivers and streams which have particular environmental or aesthetic interest...” Except where incorporated into a statute or rule, the listing is intended to provide guidance rather than to have regulatory application.”
descript.supplinf: The source list was last updated in October 1997, while the website where the list is found (http://www.in.gov/nrc/policy/outstand.html) was last updated in April 2003.

idinfo.native: ESRI ArcGIS version 9.2 shapefile format, approximately 1.69 MB

attracc.attraccr: Accurate to the published outstanding rivers list updated October 1997.

dataqual.logic: Consistent with that of the 1:100K National Hydrography Dataset. There are no known overlaps or line gaps. Each line segment ends at intersections.
dataqual.complete: All Stream segments in the NRC List of Indiana Outstanding Rivers and Streams are included. Stream segments begin and end as closely to the Described limits as the processor could determine.

horizpa.horizpar: Horizontal position is dependent on the accuracy of the National Hydrography Dataset (1:100K).

vertacc.vertaccr: The vertical positional accuracy was not a factor in the production of this shapefile.

citeinfo.title: Outstanding Rivers List for Indiana
citeinfo.othercit: In 1993, the Natural Resources Commission adopted its "Outstanding Rivers List for Indiana." The listing was published in the Indiana Register on March 1 of that year as Information Bulletin #4 in Volume 16, Number 6, page 1677 through 1680 (sometimes cited as 16 IR 1677).

srcinfo.srccontr: All base information to identify stream segments and complete attributes.

citeinfo.origin: U.S. Geological Survey & U.S. Environmental Protection Agency
citeinfo.title: HYDROGRAPHY_LINE_NHD_IN: Streams, Rivers, Canals, and Ditches in Indiana (U.S. Geological Survey, 1:100000, Polygon Shapefile)
citeinfo.othercit: Data is from the 2002 NHD data set downloadable from: http://nhd.usgs.gov/index.html

srcinfo.srccontr: Base file for river and stream lines

procstep.procdesc: National Hydrography Dataset (NHD) was copied for use as the base line file. The Outstanding Rivers List for Indiana was used to select all listed river/stream segments. Occasionally, DRGs were used to identify stream segments within the NHD which had an incomplete name field. New fields were added to the original NHD information to the attribute designation categories, special designations, and navigable status.

This metadata was pre-parsed and parsed using CNS (Chew and Spit, v 2.6.1) and MP (Metadata Parser, v 2.7.1) software written by Peter N. Schweitzer (U.S. Geological Survey). The errors generated by MP were all addressed and corrected.

attr.attrdef: Common Identifier; blanks indicate added features
Reach common identifier; blanks indicate added features
Date of reach code assignment
Main path to which a particular transport reach belongs
length of line segment in meters
Link to the Geographic Names Information System
Name of the reach
attr.attrdefs: rom RF3 validated against GNIS and U.S. Geological Survey 7.5 minute quadrangles

attr.attrdef: Feature Type

edom.edomvd: Centerline through open water bodies to facilitate hydrologic modeling
Artificial open waterway constructed to transport water, to irrigate or drain land, to connect water bodies, or to serve watercraft.

attr.attrdef: Code with detailed explanations of Ftype in table nhd.fcode
Y - river segment was also included in the "Roster of Indiana Waterways Declared Navigable," 15 IR 2385 (July 1992)
Description of the stream/river segment extent
Special Designation

Designated national Wild and Scenic Rivers. Rivers that Congress has included in the National Wild and Scenic System pursuant to the National Wild and Scenic River Act, Public Law 90-452. (Category 1)
National Wild and Scenic Study Rivers. Rivers that Congress has determined should be studied for possible inclusion in the National Wild and Scenic Rivers System. (Category 2)

Federally Protected Rivers other than Wild and Scenic. Rivers subject to federal legal protection other than pursuant to the National Wild and Scenic Rivers Act, such as National Rivers and Waterways and National Recreation Areas. (Category 3)
State designated Scenic Rivers. Rivers included in state river conservation systems or otherwise protected pursuant to an act of the state legislature. (Category 4)

Nationwide Rivers Inventory Rivers. The 1,524 river segments identified by the National Park Service in its 1982 "Nationwide Rivers Inventory" as qualified for consideration for inclusion in the National Wild and Scenic Rivers System. (Category 5)
Hydro Ban Rivers. Rivers on which Congress has prohibited future hydropower development. (Category 6)
Rivers Identified in State Inventories or Assessments. Outstanding rivers from state inventories or assessments, i.e., rivers identified as having statewide or greater significance. (Category 7)
Atlantic Salmon Restoration Rivers. Rivers undergoing active Atlantic salmon restoration efforts and identified by the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service for planned restoration. (Category 8)

Federal Public Lands Rivers. Rivers identified in U.S. Forest Service and Bureau of Land Management resource planning as potential additions to the National Wild and Scenic Rivers System. (Category 9)
State Fishing Rivers. Rivers identified by states as having outstanding fishing values, such as Blue Ribbon Trout Streams. (Category 10)
State Heritage Program Sites. Rivers identified by state natural heritage programs or similar state programs as having outstanding ecological importance. (Category 11)
Priority Aquatic Sites. Rivers identified in "Priority Aquatic Sites for Biological Diversity Conservation," published by the Nature Conservancy in 1985. (Category 12)
Canoe Trails. State-designated canoe/boating routes. (Category 13)
Outstanding Whitewater Streams. Rivers listed in the American Whitewater Affiliation's 1990 Inventory of American Whitewater. (Category 14)
Protected Rivers. Rivers protected by the strategies of local and private protection. (Category 15)
State Park Rivers. Rivers protected by inclusion in a state park or state preserve. (Category 16)
Other Rivers. Miscellaneous rivers identified as having outstanding ecological, recreational, or scenic importance. (Category 17)
High Water Quality Rivers. "Outstanding Resources Waters" designated by states and other rivers identified by states as having outstanding water quality. (Category 18)
National Natural Landmark Rivers. Rivers designated as, or included within, National Natural Landmarks. (Category 19)
State Study Rivers. Rivers that have been formally proposed for state protection or designation. (Category 20)
BOR Wester Rivers. Rivers listed in the Bureau of Outdoor Recreation's 1982 "Western U.S. Water Plan" proposal as exhibiting identified free-flowing values. (Category 21)
State Legislated Wabash River Corridor (Category 22)

distinfo.distliab:
No claims to accuracy are made on this data. It is intended to be used only for general planning purposes. Detailed planning or analysis will require more accurate data.

metainfo.metuc: This metadata file is intended to accompany the data set identified and received from the BLA/IGS. It should not to be altered or summarized. BLA/IGS does not support secondary distribution. If this data set was received from anyone besides the BLA/IGS, this metadata file and the data set it describes may lack integrity.
